thread.title: Vols go inside-out in rout of Missouri, 90-70
thread.title_full: Vols go inside-out in rout of Missouri, 90-70

title: Vols go inside-out in rout of Missouri, 90-70
text:
Tennessee's offense is at its best when it plays inside-out basketball, working through Robert Hubbs , Grant Williams and Admiral Schofield in the post. 
The formula worked Saturday against visiting Missouri. 
The three players combined to score 63 points and Tennessee led by as many as 24 while making quick work of the Tigers during a 90-70 win in front of an announced crowd of 14,680 at Thompson-Boling Arena. 
Williams scored 25 points to lead Tennessee (15-12, 7-7 SEC), Hubbs had 21 and Schofield added 17. Shembari Phillips had 10 points, his first time in double-figures since Dec. 29 against Texas A&M. 
Missouri (7-19, 2-12), having now lost 33 straight true road games, was led by Terrence Phillips , who finished with 18 points, and Kevin Puryear , who had 10. 
(Want the latest scoop on Tennessee football and basketball? Make sure you're in the loop â€” take five seconds to sign up for our FREE Vols newsletter now!) 
Hubbs finished 9-for-17 from the floor and grabbed a team-high eight rebounds. Williams was 6 of 12 from the floor, went 12-for-13 at the free throw line and had five rebounds. Schofield, who also had five boards, was 4-for-6 shooting and made 7 of 10 free throws. 
Schofield scored 10 straight points for Tennessee in the second half, putting the Vols up 59-44, then Hubbs went on a quick 4-0 run to build the lead to 19 with 10:12 left in the game. 
Tennessee led 41-28 at the break, thanks to 11 first-half points from Hubbs. 
After falling behind 2-0 at the 19:06 mark, the Vols went on a 16-1 run to take control of the game. The lead was as big as 18 with 4:49 left in the half, but Missouri answered with an 11-0 run. 
Tennessee scored eight of the game's next 10 points to go back up by 13. 
Tennessee is back at Thompson-Boling Arena on Wednesday (TV: SEC Network, 6:30 p.m.), hosting Vanderbilt (13-13, 6-7).
